availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Son of Mary Carmack. Married to Agnes F. Daniel Carmack in Campbell County, Kentucky, on July 3, 1856. Father of Mary J. Carmack, Amanda Carmack, William J. Carmack, and Mildred L. Carmack. Farmer in Campbell County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Campbell County in 1850. Farmer in Campbell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, District 2, p. 108A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, 2nd District, p. 882.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, p. 787.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Carthage, p. 166B.
Find A Grave, “Jacob Carmack (1825-1905)," Memorial #135362186, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/135362186 (accessed January 6, 2020).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Campbell County, KY, June and July 1863, p. 79, (Accessed via ancestry.com).
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Campbell County Marriages, p. 9.
